node.title: ACT records nine cases of COVID-19, no hospitalisations for the first time since August
node.alt: A hospital building seen from across a busy road.
node.description: The ACT has recorded nine new cases of COVID-19 as, for the first time since early in Canberra's lockdown, there are no people in hospital with the virus.
node.content:
["For the first time since early in Canberra's lockdown, there are no people\u00a0in hospital in the ACT with COVID-19.", "The ACT\u00a0recorded nine new\u00a0cases of COVID-19 overnight.", "There are currently\u00a0150 active cases of COVID-19 in the territory, with a total of 1,769 cases associated with the Delta outbreak.", "A total of 1,910\u00a0negative tests were received yesterday, and over 95 per cent of the eligible ACT population are now fully vaccinated.", "There are 11 deaths associated with this outbreak in the ACT.\u00a0", "
Vaccination certificates added to Check In CBR app
", "Canberrans can now add their COVID-19 vaccination certificate to the\u00a0Check In CBR app, despite proof of vaccination status not being required for entrance to most venues in the ACT.", "The\u00a0digital certificate can be linked using either the Express Plus Medicare App, or an existing myGov account.", "Once uploaded, the certificate will be available through a tab, and the\u00a0home page will show a green tick next to the individual's name.", "", "
Vaccination certificates can be linked to the app through a myGov account or\u00a0the Medicare app.(ABC News)
", "Despite the update, ACT Health said they do not intend to mandate proof of vaccination for entry into hospitality and business sectors in the territory.\u00a0", "Rather, ACT Health Minister Rachel Stephen-Smith said ease of access\u00a0was one of the main reasons for adding the new app feature.", "\"We heard from our community that having the option to demonstrate their vaccination status quickly and easily was an important to them, so the Check In CBR team has been working closely with the Australian government to add this feature to the app,\" Ms\u00a0Stephen-Smith said.", "\"While the ACT government has no plans to make proof of vaccination mandatory across sectors such as hospitality, the new Check In CBR feature will make it easier for Canberrans to provide verification of their vaccination status if required.\"", "The Check In CBR app is compatible with the family of apps used in Queensland, Tasmania and the Northern Territory.", "\"This is one of the ways that we are supporting Canberrans to transition to a new COVID normal.\"", "", "
Canberrans can now add their COVID-19 vaccination certificate to the Check In CBR app.(Supplied: ACT government)
", "ACT Health Chief Information Officer Peter O'Halloran told ABC Radio Canberra this morning that just because Canberra businesses often don't require proof of vaccination doesn't mean Canberrans don't need the feature for travel.", "\"Because Check In CBR works in three other jurisdictions it's interoperable,\" he said.", "\"It means if you go to Queensland, the Northern Territory or Tasmania, you use Check In CBR with your vaccination certificate and it's there and displayed to meet those requirements in those jurisdictions.\"", "Over the border in New South Wales, proof of full vaccination is required to enter most businesses, including shopping malls and hospitality venues, and the Service NSW app is needed to check in and out."]
